origin.li: Vladimir V. Sviridov, Igor I. Glebov, and Vladimir V. Kulik of Pacific Fisheries Research Center (TINRO-Center), Vladivostok, Russia

citeinfo.title: Distribution Data in the Western Bering Sea, Summer and Autumn of 2002 and 2003.

abstract.p: Distribution data of Pacific salmon caught in the western Bering Sea and adjacent Pacific waters in 2002-2003. Sample dates include June 15 - August 24, 2003, August 31 to October 10, 2002, and September 14 to October 25, 2003. Estimates of relative abundance (catches per 1 hour trawling) are available. All trawlings were conducted using a mid-water trawl PT 80/396 m. Vertical spread of the trawl, depending on the speed of trawl towing and weather conditions, ranged between 38 and 44 m, and horizontal one between 31 and 41 m. During 1-hour trawlings, headrope of trawl was located at the surface. The speed of trawl towing varied within the range of 3.9 - 5.3 knots.

[Reference: Vladimir V. Sviridov, Igor I. Glebov, MVladimir V. Kulik. 2004. Spatio-temporal variability in biological characteristics of Pacific salmon in the western Bering Sea. (NPAFC Doc.753) 17p. Pacific Scientific Research Fisheries Center (TINRO-center), 4, Shevchenko Alley, Vladivostok, 690950, Russia.] This report is available for download at http://www.npafc.org/restricted_doc/2004%20Documents_PDF/753(Russia).pdf

descript.purpose: To perform comparative analysis of spatio-temporal variability in biological characteristics of Pacific salmon sampled during summer and autumn of 2002 and 2003.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
